description: Indicates the number of errors that were added to the alert log when the test was last executed.
interpretation: The value of this measure is a clear indicator of the number of new alerts that have come into the alert log of the monitored database.
troubleshootingSteps: Review the database alert/error log around the time of the latest run to identify the exact error codes and messages.
Group recent errors by error code to see if a single recurring issue (e.g., space, locks, connectivity) is dominating.
Check recent configuration or deployment changes (schema changes, parameter updates, version upgrades) that coincide with the time new errors started.
Verify database resource health (disk space, I/O latency, CPU, memory, connection pool utilization) to rule out infrastructure issues.
Create alerts or thresholds on this metric so that sudden spikes in new errors trigger immediate investigation.
